text: The test case ibm52v01.xml (see below) is run using TestDriver2.java (see below) which extends the DefaultHandler class and implements the DeclHandler class of sax2-ext-1.0. There is no attributeDecl method call for or . ================================================================================ Test case ibm52v01.xml: ================================================================================ ]> Element type a test P52 and P53 ================================================================================ The Actual result: ================================================================================ DeclHandler: elementDecl (String name, String model) name: root model: ANY DeclHandler: elementDecl (String name, String model) name: a model: (#PCDATA)* DeclHandler: elementDecl (String name, String model) name: b model: (#PCDATA) DeclHandler: attributeDecl (String elementName, String attributeName, String type, String valueDefault, String value) elementName: b attributeName: battr1 type: CDATA valueDefault: #REQUIRED value: null DeclHandler: attributeDecl (String elementName, String attributeName, String type, String valueDefault, String value) elementName: b attributeName: battr2 type: CDATA valueDefault: #IMPLIED value: null DeclHandler: attributeDecl (String elementName, String attributeName, String type, String valueDefault, String value) elementName: b attributeName: battr3 type: CDATA valueDefault: #FIXED value: fixedvalue DeclHandler: attributeDecl (String elementName, String attributeName, String type, String valueDefault, String value) elementName: b attributeName: battr4 type: (abc|def) valueDefault: null value: abc ================================================================================ Steps to Reproduce: ================================================================================ 1. The TestDriver2.java program and its compiled binary (TestDriver2.class) are attached. Save the class file to your local drive. 2. Set the classpath pointing to the xerces.jar file and the directory storing TestDriver2.class file. 3. Run TestDriver in the directory storing the TestDriver.class file using the command below: java TestDriver d [uri of ibm52v01.xml] t d --- default parser class (which is set to org.apache.xerces.parsers.SAXParser); uri --- the full uri of the file in the local system. e.g. "d:/Test/ibm52v01.xml" t --- to set validation to "true", any other input will set validation to "false" ================================================================================ Platform: I have only run the test locally with WIN2000 and JDK1.3. ================================================================================
